column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=10 Weight % Fluorinated Ceramer with 1.47 TEOS/Polymer and 0.67 MEK-ST Silica/TEOS
#Text=[0116] In a glass jar, to a stirred solution of ORGANOSILICASOL.TM.

#Text=MEK-ST (19.86 g), isopropyl alcohol (19 ml), and 0.15 N triflic acid (3.42 ml) was added the 10 weight % Fluoroceramer Masterbatch (25.0 g) that had been previously diluted with isopropanol (IPA) (20 ml).

#Text=Additional IPA (60 ml) was added slowly to achieve a clear solution of the fluoroceramer containing the silica particles, followed by dropwise addition of tetraethoxyorthosilicate (TEOS, 8.83 g, 0.039 mol).
#Text=The solution was then stirred at room temperature for 48 hours, after which Silwet.RTM.
#Text=L-7001 (0.88 g of a 10 weight % solution in IPA) was added.
#Text=The solution was stirred overnight and diluted with 62 g of addition IPA to 8 weight % solids before coating onto polyurethane blades.
#Text=[0117] The polyurethane cleaning blade substrates were spray coated with this solution using a Preval.TM. lab sprayer or coated with a brush.
#Text=The coatings were cured by placing the cleaning blade members in an oven and increasing the temperature to 80.degree.
#Text=C. over 1 hour and maintaining the temperature for 24 hours.

#Text=Alternatively, a ring-coater was used to pull a polyurethane slab (for example, 380 mm.times.25 mm.times.1.9 mm) through a gasket that had the fluoroceramer coating solution sitting on top of it.
#Text=The coating was cured as described above and attached to a metal housing to form a fluoroceramer coated polyurethane cleaning blade.
#Text=[0118] These fluoroceramer coated cleaning blade members were analyzed for coefficient of friction.
#Text=A 6.5 cm in length strip of coated elastomer was attached to the bottom of a 200 g weighted sled using double sided plastic adhesive tape.
#Text=The sled was pulled over a sheet of photoconductor that had been placed on a vacuum platen.

#Text=A load cell was used to measure the force needed to move the fluoroceramer coating against the photoconductor, the results were recorded using a computer, and the static and dynamic coefficients of friction were calculated.
#Text=A graph was generated during these experiments to eliminate samples where the sled 200 g weight would leap or jump because of a stick-slip type of friction.
#Text=The fluoroceramer coated wiper blade of this invention was found to have a static coefficient of friction of 0.5 and a kinetic coefficient of friction of 0.4.
#Text=In contrast, the uncoated polyurethane elastomer stuck to the photoconductor and the coefficient of friction could not be measured.
#Text=Invention Example 2 and Comparative Example 1
